# Anatomy

Types of cervical rib:

- Type I: complete cervical rib articulates with the first rib or manubrium of sternum @hooperThoracicOutletSyndrome2010
- Type II: incomplete cervical ribs with a free end expanded to form a bulbous tip @hooperThoracicOutletSyndrome2010
- Type III: an incomplete rib that is continued by a fibrous band @hooperThoracicOutletSyndrome2010
- Type Iv: rib that appears as a short bar of bone with a length of a few millimeters beyond the C7 TP @hooperThoracicOutletSyndrome2010

# Elevation {#elevation}

1st rib elevation is a cause of [Thoracic Outlet Syndrome]({{< var ref-thoracic-outlet.syndrome >}}) @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020

# Hypomobility {#hypomobility}

1st Rib hypomobility or restriction can be caused by:

- 1st rib subluxation at costotransverse joint

Can result in secondary pathologies, such as:

-  Thoracic outlet syndrome (TOS)

- Tests:
    - [Cervical Rotation Lateral Flexion]({{< ref-cervical-rotation-lateral-flexion.path >}})
    - [Costoclavicular Test]({{< var ref-tos-costoclavicular-test.path >}})
